intro: Dombeya nodiflora, commonly known as the nodding dombeya, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It features showy, fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of its branches. The plant has smooth, greyish-green leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Dombeya nodiflora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
